description:
Almost unusable as snap package.

Also freezing when opening context menu was resolved by removing "opengl" permission (via Discover on KDE)

its made by microsft = spyware
and its also bloatware
Right-clicking on a message in the chat cause Skype to freeze entirely.
summary: A couple of the last versions are unusable

description:
Normally I don't write reviews or comments for flatpak apps but I felt I should write this because the in-repo package for Arch DOES NOT have the issue this flatpak version of skype has with Plasma 6 (X11) where it will not correctly save the login details with kdewallet and triggers a misbehaving application warning from kdewallet. 

This may not affect everyone but the fact the in-repo package works just fine and the flatpak doesn't means there is something wrong with this flatpak and it needs a fix. Until then I can't use it, as I tried MANY things to get it to play nice with kdewallet and it just kept misbehaving (a actual error output from kdewallet).
Flatpak'ed version of Skype doesn't remember password on restart and doesn't receive calls.

First of all, the app very often does not start at all. This already makes it unusable. Furthermore, the option to start it on system boot also does not work correctly. And the start minimised option completely makes the software unusable.

If you're on arch use the AUR package instead of this flatpak trash.
does not open most of the time
There is not that much to say. It works most of the times and up to now I have not had a major problem with it.
Normal calls are working, but video conferences not. Screensharing from others looks like an old tea. But it's better than Skype alpha.
I can't login because the process is terminating.
Great app for Linux, but please improve the anti-aliasing, it looks quite blurry on my screen.
It's working almost complete for an alpha version and the new features are all ok so far.
Not good. It is very slow and many bug.
Can't get the application to even log in using the business skype that we have.
The skype works fine for me but I cannot join calls with other skype linux users.
It's looking a lot better than the previous version!
It cuts out after about 10 minutes or so doing cam. It also hardly has any options compared with the Windows Skype.
summary: Beta release, video cuts out a lot

description: It's a shame Skype for Linux doesn't store any of the files offline like it does on Windows. I would love for that to happen.
I was not able to find a way to configure microphone and camera.
summary: Unable to configure mic and video

description: Screen sharing is missing, and it's not very well integrated in GNOME.
Not a single issue.

Spent hours making my headset mic work with skype tweaking pulseaudio but still no luck, I noticed skype in windows has option to choose camera and microphone but missing it is missing in skype for linux.

Why bother installed this application when you can just go to web.skype.com and get the same thing? I want to have a local database just like on other platforms. Shows how much Microsoft hates freedom. Disgusting!
summary: It's just a website. Make it better!

description: No notification for a contact whose message window is already open. So I	 often don't know if the contact sends me a new message
summary: No notification for a contact whose message window is already open

description: Improved greatly since released for Linux. Share screen is enabled. Keep up the good work.

Design is hideous and it is not possible to see all messages from the beginning without scrolling. Why would you remove "show messages from the beginning of the time"? Also, I didn't find the search in messages.
The saying goes if it aint broken don't fix it. Yet here is another of MS total messes.
Screen sharing does not work.
Not working, messages disappear, so as history.

Microsoft has now published three versions - THREE - that do not work for anyone to the skype-stable repository. The latest version that works is 8.11. Skype for Linux still lacks most of the features the Windows version has, like screen sharing and detailed settings/technical information available. These are things they said they were working on years ago and would implement "soon," but still haven't. Use Skype only if you have to, otherwise you're in for a headache with a dev team that will never support their own program on Linux as well as they do on Windows.
Does its job well. Some features are missing and hopefully will be added later.
Most main skype functions and settings don't work or was cutted.It's even can't normally uninstalled.
Very happy with Skype for Linux

I don't really see why is so many people mad about this. I've used this version and the Windows version and, as weird as it sounds, Skype client worked way better than their Windows counterparts for months until recently they updated them to match the Linux version.

Message integration works fine, messages always arrive on time, and I have all of the features I need for my work communication workflow, it just works.
Terrible update
summary: Lot of corners cut from version 7.4

description:
I have been using Skype since it appeared on windows like 8 or more years ago (2010); then MS bought it and became as buggy and unstable as it seems. If you sum that they even hadn't tried to made a "decent" version or something relatable as in Windows...
In conclusion, if on Windows sucks, on Linux, Skype is the worst app ever made. Use Discord instead.

Whoever came with this idea thought is smart and the users are dumb.
Bye bye, Skype!
Is time for other apps to try their luck

description: Why am I bothering? Because lots of my contacts use Skype and I am around the other side of the world right now. What did I discover? It doesn't work, no there is a surprise. All fine except that the audio at my caller's end is inaudible. They can't hear a word I am saying. Checked it out. Common fault ever since Microsoft released their all singing all dancing Linux Skype. There are a software conflicts. On the forums, the Skype developer insists Skype works, as usual, and that the problem is with the Linux users not being 'up to speed'. can't be bothered with it any more. I'm using the landline and bugger the cost.

Skype is stable, easy to use and large community for Linux users.

Considering that the only way you can ever convince me to run Skype is to run it in a sandbox, this works well. The application appears to be packaged correctly and is usable as expected on GNOME 3.26, but the app itself (as developed by Microsoft) is still horribly lacking.

A better alternative is Wire.com; which is free/libre and works way better than Skype (probably ever will).
I'm blown away by the ease of installation. I don't like the app, but the integration with gnome-software and flathub is awsome! Additional thanks to MS for working with linux!
summary: Best way to run skype on linux

description:
Definitely impressed with this Flatpak; everything installs and runs perfectly fine on my system. The fact that Skype runs in a sandbox is particularly welcome, as it allows me to toss out the native installation and replace it with something I can reasonably trust. Disclaimer: I generally dislike Skype as a service and application, but this is not meant as a critique of the technology itself.

The packagers at FlatHub did a good job of packaging it up, the installation was simple through GNOME Software, and everything seems to work as it. If you must use Skype for whatever reason, there is no better way than this.
Es ist halt Skype, mehr muss man dazu nicht sagen!

Die Neue Version von Skype (8.9.0.1) Zeigt alle Kontakte wieder gut an, der Katalog ist eine gute, einfache Methode Dateien zu teilen. Leider fehlt die Option die Schrift zu vergrößern, dies geht nur durch eine Art Zoom. Die schönen animierten Emoticons sind ebenfalls im Vergleich zur Alpha kleiner geworden :(
Ich bin trotzdem froh über die Akualisierung, es läuft. Außerdem ist diese furchtbare Anrufmelodie entfernt worden.
summary: Super, dass die Linux-Version aktualisiert wurde

description:
Modern look is nice, but those features are missing (or are hard to find):

- search in the history of one chat - in the complete history

Es ist zwar ein Microsoft-Produkt, um aber mit anderen "Nicht-Linux-Benutzern" zum beispiel inder aktuellen Corona-Pandemie Kontakt zu halten, neben Discord eines der wichtigsten Programme. 
Weil ich Microsoft nicht mag: -1 Stern

Ich bin absoluter Linux Neuling (Zorin 15). 
Ich habe zuerst die aktuelle Skype Version installiert, da startete es auch nicht. Dann habe ich mir eine ältere Skype Version runter geladen. wenn ich die installieren will sagt es mir "Skype ist schon installiert" und dann habe ich aber die Option "Skype starten" und wenn ich das auswähle, dann startet es. 
Bis das Problem von Microsoft behoben wurde behalte ich einfach diese alte Version in den Downloads und starte es darüber
summary: Ich hoffe das Problem wird noch gelöst

description:
Das Programm funktioniert mit einem Lenovo Ideapad 130S und Xubuntu 20.04 LTS.

Wer auf die schnelle eine Konferenz ohne Programm starten möchte, sei https://meet.jit.si/ empfohlen.

Wer Skype z.B. aus geschäftlichen Gründen braucht wird mit dieser Linux Version zufriden sein. Sie funktioniert soweit ich das nachvollziehen kann genauso gut wie das MS original. 
Ich bin ja selber kein Microsoft Fan aber die meisten Bewertungen scheinen hier nur ihrem Hass Ausdruck verleihen zu wollen und beziehen sich nicht wirklich auf die Anwendung.
The audio input and output broke with some recent updated of the snap package. Skype is not usable in this form.
Nach gefühlten Stunden der Installation und bis es dann tatsächlich startet... wird die Kamera nicht erkannt :( ... vielleicht liegt es ja an was Anderem... meinem Gerät.. keine Ahnung
would be great for a software to start working at all
installation problem
Kann man besser machen.

Ich verwende Skype mit Ubuntu 20.04.1 auf einem Acer Nitro 5 (AN517-51). Installation war unter einer Minute abgeschlossen, Audiokomponenten und Kamera sofort erkannt, funktioniert einwandfrei. Nichts zu beanstanden.

Im zweiten Lockdown suchte ich nach Kommunikationssoftware für mein etwa 12 Jahre altes Targa-Netbook mit einem aktuellen Ubuntu-Linux-Derivat. Hardware-mäßig wäre es wegen eingebauter Kamera und Ohrhöreranschluss prinzipiell zum Skypen geeignet. Zunächst war ich positiv überrascht, dass mir mein Betriebssystem überhaupt Skype zur Installation anbot, weil ich es bislang gewohnt war, dass dieses nur für Windows angeboten wurde. 
Die Installation verlief dann stockend und schleppend. Danach stellte ich fest, dass außer einem Eintrag im Programmmenü wohl nichts passierte. Ein Klick auf eben diesen Eintrag bewirkte dann überhaupt nichts. Das Programm ist bei mir ohne Funktion.
summary: Ohne Funktion auf älterer Hardware unter aktuellem Linux

description: Wir sind froh, dass es eine aktuelle Version von Skype für Linux gibt, die die volle Funktionalität enthält und sehr gut funktioniert.

La aplicación en sí funciona bien pero tiene un montón de bugs. Por ejemplo, no me permite enviar archivos desde la propia aplicación si están almacenados en el disco raíz (a través de un pendrive o un disco externo sí te deja enviarlos). Incluso probé varias cosas para arreglarlo pero sigue sin funcionar. El compartir pantalla no me funciona por lo que es otro error importante. En resumen una aplicación mal implementada muy bonita pero con poca funcionalidad.

description: Marche impeccablement en audio, vidéo, chat et transfert ou partage d'écran. Seul souci: la notification erronée de nouvelle version alors que j'ai la dernière version dispo pour mon système d'exploitation...

Bonjour, idem que les commentaires précédents, dernière version installée et dans notifications de Skype il me demande de faire la dernière MàJ depuis le gestionnaire de package etc... alors que c'est la dernière version 8.51.0.72, je suis sur Ubuntu 18.04.3 LST(tout à jour).
il ne se lance pas

skype est pratique mais comment l'installer sur ubuntu?
Je clique sur "lancer", rien ne se passe ...

Alors que je n'avais aucun souci sur les anciennes versions, ici tous mes réglages ont sauté, et surtout je ne peux faire aucun transfert de fichiers, l'application se ferme automatiquement, y compris quand je veux changer la photo de mon profil. De plus quand je veux trouver un fichier dans mon ordinateur à partir de skype, je n'ai plus les anciens chemins, tout est en anglais et réduit à home, il n'y a plus d'accès direct à Images, Documents, etc

Bon fonctionnement général, tout marche (tchat, vocal, partage de fichiers...) mais la qualité des appels vocaux laisse souvent à désirer. De plus, j'ai une notification "une nouvelle version est disponible, installez la depuis le gestionnaire de package" alors que mon OS et skype sont à jour.

 перестал отправлять, зато интерфес поменяли...
Если вы решили установить скайп, то устанавливайте deb пакет с официального сайта. Я сначала удаляю старую версию потом устанавливаю новую. Вот такие дела...
обновляется работает как надо. главное прописать в репозитарий
Даже не запускается. -))))

поставил отсюда версию, она установилась в /snap/skype/109/ при этом, замечен большой глюк: при отправке картинок в чат, после нажания кнопки "отправить" окно программы становится белым и ничего не работает в нем, спасает только закрыть программу и открыть ее заново.
а также глюк поменьше но тоже неприятный, при выборе файлов для отправки по умодчанию открывается папка в /home/username/snap/skype

что не удобно совсем, и окно выбора файлов английское и урезанное, без возможности выбора моих папок, таких как загрузки, документы, рабочий стол (из переменных моего окружения)

Поэтому ставьте из офф. сайта с deb пакета, и все в нем работает нормально и без глюков и в папку /usr/share/skypeforlinux т.е. ставиться и интергируется нормально в систему, без snap-ов.
summary: не рекомендую ставить отсюда, лучше с офф. сайта
